definition: to toss about in bed/from person to person/indirectly/to wander
roll over on side/turn half over
see 轉文|转文[zhuai3 wen2]
to revolve/to turn/to circle about/to walk about/classifier for revolutions (per minute etc): revs, rpm/classifier for repeated actions
to turn/to change direction/to transfer/to forward (mail)
to toss and turn restlessly (in the bed)

sentences.english: I turn to the provincial capital.
It's possible that nightly nicotine withdrawal could be causing you to toss and turn.
sentences.chinese: 可能是因为尼古丁的残留物在夜间会使你辗转反侧。

sentences.english: Are you going to let yourself be tossed around by events beyond your control?
sentences.chinese: 你还想让自己被那些自己无法控制的事情辗转不宁吗？

sentences.english: All night long night oil lamp, I traveled difficult to sleep .
sentences.chinese: 油尽灯灭如斯长夜，我辗转难入睡。

sentences.english: Previously, in her eyes he only China Merchants traveled in Western and other places.
sentences.chinese: 以前，在她眼里他只是中原的茶商辗转在西域等地。

sentences.english: Zhou came to the family several times around, we found that there was no such person in the station.
sentences.chinese: 周某家人几经辗转赶去后，发现该车站并无此人。

sentences.english: Still, you're not doomed to toss and turn night after night.
sentences.chinese: 然而，你并非注定要夜夜辗转反侧。

sentences.english: He tossed on the ground that night.
sentences.chinese: 那天夜里他在地上辗转反侧。

sentences.english: He was talking in his sleep and moving uneasily on the bed.
sentences.chinese: 他在说梦话而且在床上不安地辗转反侧着。

sentences.english: He was tossing and turning in bed.
I tossed and turned in bed all night.
Removed later, you still put my hand open.
sentences.chinese: 辗转以后，你还是把我的手放开。

sentences.english: You hear about fantastic networking opportunities second- or thirdhand.
sentences.chinese: 你会辗转听到拓展人脉关系的美妙机会。
擦拭厨房的工作台面和辗转。

sentences.english: And of nights when earth was upwrought with confusion
sentences.chinese: 也记录了那些黑夜，当时大地在混沌困惑中辗转不安。

sentences.english: When tears come down like falling rain, you'll toss around and call my name.
sentences.chinese: 当泪如雨下，你将辗转反侧呼唤我的名字。

definition: roll over on side/turn half over
to travel to (a distant place)
to go through numerous (setbacks, revisions etc)
to rush about/to be constantly on the move
destitute/difficulty/hardship/trouble
homeless and miserable (idiom); to wander about in a desperate plight/to drift
homeless and miserable/forced to leave home and wander from place to place/to live as a refugee
alone/by oneself
to run this way and that (idiom); to rush about busily/to bustle about/to hopscotch/also 東跑西顛|东跑西颠[dong1 pao3 xi1 dian1]
to rush to/to hurry to
to trudge/to trek
to cross (the wide ocean)
to drift (in the tide)/to rove/to lead a wandering existence/drifter/wanderer
to stay for a time/to stop over/to lodge/to sink down (into soft ground)/leftovers
to fight in one place after another
to travel over land and water (idiom)
